entry.title: UMCD NKI group tractography eigenmodes
entry.summary:
Alternative versions: LabNotebook, nbviewer, slides, pdf

Contents

  • Overview
  • Background & Analysis Procedures
  • Summary of results
  • Notebook setup
  • Sort and re-label data
  • Run matlab analyses
  • Load in results
  • Connectivity matrices
    • Original connectivity matrices
    • Reorganized connectivity matrices
  • Mode topographies
    • Comparison point: Laplace-Beltrami eigenmodes for left hemisphere cortical surface
    • Make surface figure and scatter plot montages
    • Unihemispheric aCM eigenmode topographies
    • Bihemispheric aCM eigenmode topographies
  • Eigenvector Histograms
    • Group unihemispheric aCM eigenvector histograms
    • Group bihemispheric aCM eigenvector histograms
  • Eigenvalues
  • Spherical Harmonic Coefficients
    • [Make spherical harmonic coefficient 'P1' figures](#Make-spherical-harmonic-coefficient-'P1'-figures)
    • [Group unihemispheric aCM eigenmode SH 'P1' coeffs](#Group-unihemispheric-aCM-eigenmode-SH-'P1'-coeffs)
    • [Group bihemispheric aCM eigenmode SH 'P1' coeffs](#Group-bihemispheric-aCM-eigenmode-SH-'P1'-coeffs)

Overview¶

The following pages document and summarize investigations into eigenmode structure of connectivity matrices from the NKI-Rockland dataset, as obtained from the USC multimodal connectivity database (UMCD). These analyses are one part of a larger ongoing project, including similar analyses of several other datasets, and so motivations, background theory, and analysis details are described here minimally. However, the full code for everything included in this report can be seen in the HTML version, which takes care of the lion's share of documentation requirements.

The primary aim of this notebook is to document the analysis steps (including complete code), and show the results as they stand at this point in time. As these are still somewhat exploratory analyses, and include a variety of data visualizations for several subjects, the following sections contain a very large amount of figures, which by necessity are only very sparsely commented on. The 'summary of results' section below discusses some of the key points of interest, however there may well be further important patterns in the figures and data presented that I have not noticed or had time to comment on. So please feel free to feed back new observations and comments.

Notebook setup¶

Enable matlab in the notebook

%load_ext pymatbridge

Starting MATLAB on ZMQ socket ipc:///tmp/pymatbridge-9052d3d8-72ff-429d-8fed-8c4a93a75ccd
Send 'exit' command to kill the server
.....................................................MATLAB started and connected!

Calico document tools

%%javascript
IPython.load_extensions('calico-spell-check'  'calico-document-tools','calico-cell-tools');

Define some variables

# define system-specific filepaths etc
%run ~/set_localenv_vars.py

# output dir
outdir = le['data_dir'] + '/notebooks/umcd_nki_group_eigenmodes'
!mkdir -p $outdir


# eigenmodes github repo
em_repo_dir  = le['code_dir'] + '/libraries_of_mine/github/eigenmodes'

# stuff for dropbox api
nb_name = 'umcd_nki_group_eigenmodes'

# stuff for analyses

nki_modified_matfile = outdir + '/nki_grp_modified.mat'
nki_modified_matfile_github = em_repo_dir + '/jg/nki_grp_modified.mat'

nki_dir = le['data_dir'] + '/UMCD/downloaded/NKI_Rockland'

nki_grp_aCM_textfile = nki_dir + '/NKI_dti_avg_connectivity_matrix_file.txt'
nki_grp_xyzs_textfile = nki_dir + '/NKI_dti_avg_region_xyz_centers_file.txt'
nki_grp_regionnames_textfile = nki_dir + '/NKI_dti_avg_region_names_full_file.txt'


# stuff for workdocs-cloudfiles

aws_key = 'drowssaperucesyreva'
aws_secret = '?teytidettopsuoyevah'  

nki_modified_matfile = outdir + '/nki_grp_modified.mat'
nki_modified_matfile_github = em_repo_dir + '/jg/data/nki_grp_modified.mat'

Importage

# Generic stuff

import os,sys

import pandas as pd
from pandas import DataFrame,concat

import numpy as np
from numpy import flipud,diag

from  scipy.io import loadmat,savemat


# Visualization stuff

%matplotlib inline
from matplotlib import cm,pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

from IPython.display import Image,clear_output,display as d


# Workdocs-cloudfiles stuff
sys.path.append(le['ipynb_workdocs_dir'])
from new_utils import nb_fig,cloudfiles_nb



# Eigenmodes github repo stuff

sys.path.append(em_repo_dir + '/jg')
from eigenmodes_utils import make_surf_montage,make_unihemi_scatter_montage,\
                             make_bihemi_scatter_montage,get_reordered_conmat,\
                             parse_nki_data

Set up aws workdocs-cloudfiles api

cnb = cloudfiles_nb('aws', [aws_key,aws_secret])
cnb.initialize_folder(nb_name)

Go to output directory

os.chdir(outdir)

%%matlab -i outdir
cd(outdir)

Ok, let's get cracking!

Sort and re-label data¶

We can't use the data directly as-is from the UMCD database, for a number of reasons:

TIDY THIS

  1. The labels are non-unique (i.e. multiple regions have the same label)
  2. We don't know the left-right ordering of the labels in advance.
  3. (relatedly): the roi xyz coordinates for the individual subjects data are in native space. This means that we can't use region centroids' x coordinates to determine which hemisphere, and more to the point, we can't map them on to our parcellation labels using nearest geodesic distance, as we have been doing so far
  4. There are subcortical regions which we want to exclude in this analysis.

So the following does some sorting, ordering, re-labelling, and filtering in python, then saves the resultant data structures to .mat files so that we can proceed as above using the matlab analysis and visualization code.

The matlab script accompanying this notebook expects this file to be present and loads it in; so the cells in this section need to be executed first if one is running the whole analysis from scratch.

Don't worry, it's very quick.

Reading and manipulating text and text files is much less painful in python than it is in matlab.

The imports define a function for reading in data and stuff

Run this on three sets of data: the group-averaged aCM data, the group-averaged fCM data, and invidual subjects' aCM data

Put the resultant variables in a dictionary, to be saved to .mat file

matdict = {}

# Group averaged aCM data

grp_aCM_dat = parse_nki_data(nki_grp_regionnames_textfile,
                             nki_grp_aCM_textfile,
                             nki_grp_xyzs_textfile)

matdict['nki_grp_aCM_conmat'] = grp_aCM_dat[0]
matdict['nki_grp_aCM_labels'] = grp_aCM_dat[1]
matdict['nki_grp_aCM_lh_inds'] = grp_aCM_dat[2]+1 # ADD 1 TO THE INDICES
matdict['nki_grp_aCM_rh_inds'] = grp_aCM_dat[3]+1 # ...COS THESE ARE FOR MATLAB
matdict['nki_grp_aCM_roi_xyz'] = grp_aCM_dat[4]

# Group averaged fCM data

grp_fCM_dat = parse_nki_data(nki_grp_fc_regionnames_texttfile,
                             nki_grp_fCM_textfile,
                             nki_grp_fc_xyzs_textfile)

matdict['nki_grp_fCM_conmat'] = grp_fCM_dat[0]
matdict['nki_grp_fCM_labels'] = grp_fCM_dat[1]
matdict['nki_grp_fCM_lh_inds'] = grp_fCM_dat[2]+1
matdict['nki_grp_fCM_rh_inds'] = grp_fCM_dat[3]+1
matdict['nki_grp_fCM_roi_xyz'] = grp_fCM_dat[4]

Now save this to .mat file

savemat(nki_modified_matfile,matdict)

savemat(nki_modified_matfile_github, matdict)

Run matlab analyses¶

Note: this takes a long time to run, but that is principally generating the figures.

To run the analyses without generating the figures, comment out all the lines which add the 'sfopt' structure into the 'opt' structure. This will run through the whole thing and spit out the .mat file results in a few minutes.

(note: eigenmodes colour palettes file copied to github repo from eigenmodes_colour_palettes notebook)

Load in results¶

This is required for most of the sections below

# the above jg_compute_modes.m calls outputs the following  ' _data.mat' files:
res_files = {'mpt':   outdir + '/nki_grp_aCM__mpt_data.mat',
                   'nompt': outdir + '/nki_grp_aCM__nompt_data.mat'}
 
# load in the .mat files
res_mats = {k: loadmat(v, squeeze_me=True,struct_as_record=False)['modecomps']  for k,v in res_files.items()}

Connectivity matrices¶

These are included really just for completeness / sanity check. They don't show anything of particular relevance here. Note that the reason why it is hard to see much in them is because the parcellation size is pretty dense (500 nodes per hemisphere); connectivity matrices from coarser parcellations are a little easier to eyeball.

Original connectivity matrices¶

for m in ['mpt', 'nompt']: 
 
  dat = res_mats[m].bihemi.dat

  # with colourbar
  f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_conmat_cbar.png' %(outdir,m)
    
  fig, ax = plt.subplots()#figsize=(10,10))
  sns.heatmap(dat, linewidths=0, square=True, ax=ax,vmax=0.05,
                xticklabels=False, yticklabels=False,cmap='jet')
  plt.tight_layout()
  plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight',dpi=600)
  plt.close()
    
  # without colourbar
  f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_conmat_nocbar.png' %(outdir,m)
    
  fig, ax = plt.subplots()#figsize=(10,10))
  sns.heatmap(dat, linewidths=0, square=True, ax=ax,vmax=0.05,
              xticklabels=False, yticklabels=False,cmap='jet',cbar=False)
  plt.tight_layout()
  plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight',dpi=600)
  plt.close()

ax.axis('off')

#Image(f, width='100%')
. 
def cluster_connectivity_within_hemispheres(conmat,lh_inds,rh_inds):
    
  """
  Reorder indices of a connectivity matrix, keeping
  two-block left/right hemisphere structure, with 
  dendrogram clustering used to determine the order of 
  nodes within each hemisphere block
  """
    
  # remove any non-cortical rois
 
  orig_inds = range(conmat.shape[0])

  lhrh_inds = lh_inds+rh_inds
  alist = range(conmat.shape[0])
  other_inds = [a for a in alist if a not in lhrh_inds]

  block_inds = lh_inds+rh_inds+other_inds
    
    
  reordered_inds = np.zeros_like(orig_inds)

  lh_cluster = sns.clustermap(conmat[lh_inds,:][:,lh_inds],cmap='jet',linewidth=0)
  plt.close()
  lh_reordered_inds = lh_cluster.dendrogram_col.reordered_ind

  rh_cluster = sns.clustermap(conmat[rh_inds,:][:,rh_inds],cmap='jet',linewidth=0)
  plt.close()
  rh_reordered_inds = rh_cluster.dendrogram_col.reordered_ind
  rh_reordered_inds_mod = list(np.array(rh_reordered_inds)+len(lh_inds))

  other_reordered_inds = list(np.arange(len(other_inds))+len(lhrh_inds))


  reordered_inds[lh_inds] = lh_reordered_inds
  reordered_inds[rh_inds] = rh_reordered_inds_mod
  reordered_inds[other_inds] = other_reordered_inds
  

  #clustered_conmat = conmat[reordered_inds,:][:,reordered_inds]
    
  reordered_inds = lh_reordered_inds+rh_reordered_inds_mod+other_reordered_inds
    
  clustered_conmat = conmat[block_inds,:][:,block_inds][reordered_inds,:][:,reordered_inds]
    
  #new_clustered_conmat = conmat[lh_inds+rh_inds+other_inds,:][:,lh_inds+rh_inds][stuff[2]+stuff[4],:][:,stuff[2]+stuff[4]]
    
  return clustered_conmat,reordered_inds,block_inds,lh_reordered_inds,rh_reordered_inds,rh_reordered_inds_mod,other_reordered_inds

fig, ax = plt.subplots()#

lh_inds = list(dat.bihemi.hemi_inds.lh-1)
rh_inds = list(dat.bihemi.hemi_inds.rh-1)
conmat = dat.bihemi.dat
newdat = cluster_connectivity_within_hemispheres(conmat,lh_inds,rh_inds)[0]

ax.imshow(np.log1p(newdat),interpolation=None,cmap='jet')
ax.set_title('NKI group aCM, withinhemi-clustered')


ax.axis('off')
plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

Mode topographies¶

Comparison point: Laplace-Beltrami eigenmodes for left hemisphere cortical surface¶

Note the three key patterns: posterior/anterior split (mode 2), inferior-superior split (mode 3), and lateral/medial split, and/or 'stripe down the middle' (mode 4).

(A more comprehensive evaluation of these patterns is given in a separate notebook).

(0_0) 
f = '%s/LH_LB_eigs_1to4.png' %outdir
label = ''
cap = ''
fignum = '1.0'
#im = nb_fig(f,label,cap,fignum,cnb,size=(500,700))#,upload_file=False)
#d(im)

Image(f, width='100%')
Out[12]:

Make surface figure and scatter plot montages¶

 
doscatters=True
dosurfaces=False


# blue-red colour palette
divpal_260_15_99_57_1_120 = sns.diverging_palette(h_neg=260,h_pos=15,s=99,l=57,sep=2,
                                                  n=120,as_cmap=True)
brcmap=divpal_260_15_99_57_1_120

nes = 10


# need to test out the crops manually before running the whole thing


# these are the crops that work right when I run the matlab figure generation code in 'normal ' matlab
crops = {'ctp': 55, 'cbp': 70, 'cts': 65, 'cbs': 70, # crop top/bottom pial/sphere
         'clp': 160, 'crp': 100, 'cls': 305, 'crs': 260, #crop left/right pial/sphere
         'ctw': 40, 'cbw': 40, 'ctb': 1, 'cbb': 1, # crop top/bottom wmap/colorbar
         'clw': 160, 'crw': 115, 'clb': 10, 'crb': 60} # crop left/right wmap/colorbar

# the ones that work best for when running matlab inside the notebook with pymatbridge are the 
# defaults in make_surf_montage
# (for that, set crops=None, or just don't supply the crops argument in the function calls)
        
for k,v in   [ res_mats.items()[0]  ]:
        
        
    print '\n\nloading %s data...' %k
    dat = v
    
    inds_lh = dat.lh.hemi_inds.lh-1
    roi_xyz_lh = dat.lh.roi_xyz[inds_lh,:]
    
    if 'nompt' in k:
      V_lh = dat.lh.V
      V_rh = dat.rh.V
      V_bihemi = dat.bihemi.V
    else: 
      V_lh = dat.lh.V_dp
      V_rh = dat.rh.V_dp
      V_bihemi = dat.bihemi.V_dp

        
    V_bin_lh = V_lh.copy()
    V_bin_lh[V_lh<0] = -1
    V_bin_lh[V_lh>0] = 1

    inds_rh = dat.rh.hemi_inds.rh-1
    roi_xyz_rh = dat.rh.roi_xyz[inds_rh,:]
    V_bin_rh = V_rh.copy()
    V_bin_rh[V_rh<0] = -1
    V_bin_rh[V_rh>0] = 1

    roi_xyz_bihemi = dat.bihemi.roi_xyz
    V_bin_bihemi = V_bihemi.copy()
    V_bin_bihemi[V_bihemi<0] = -1
    V_bin_bihemi[V_bihemi>0] = 1    
  
    
    
    for unibi in ['unihemi', 'bihemi']:
        
        
        
    
      # Scatter plots
      # ==============
    
      if doscatters:
            
        print '\nmaking %s scatter plots...' %(unibi)
        
        modes2do = [1,2,3,4]
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_binarized_redblue_scatter_modes1to4.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        if unibi == 'unihemi':
          make_unihemi_scatter_montage(roi_xyz_lh,roi_xyz_rh,V_bin_lh,V_bin_rh,modes2do,f,cmap=brcmap)
        elif unibi == 'bihemi':
          make_bihemi_scatter_montage(roi_xyz_bihemi,V_bin_bihemi,modes2do,f,cmap=brcmap)
        
        modes2do = [5,6,7,8,9]
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_binarized_redblue_scatter_modes5to9.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        if unibi == 'unihemi':
          make_unihemi_scatter_montage(roi_xyz_lh,roi_xyz_rh,V_bin_lh,V_bin_rh,modes2do,f,cmap=brcmap)
        elif unibi == 'bihemi':
          make_bihemi_scatter_montage(roi_xyz_bihemi,V_bin_bihemi,modes2do,f,cmap=brcmap)
        
        
        
      # Surface figures
      # ================
    
      if dosurfaces:
            
                
        print '\nmaking %s surface figs...' %(unibi)
                    
        # make montages  
     
        astr = 'nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_lh_binarized_redblue' %(k,unibi)
  
        for e_it, e in enumerate(range(nes)):
       
          lh_surfoutfile = '%s/%s_mode%s_montage_nocbar.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
        
          f1= '%s/%s_mode%s_pial_latview.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
          f2= '%s/%s_mode%s_sphere_latview.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
          f3= '%s/%s_mode%s_sphere_medview.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
          f4= '%s/%s_mode%s_pial_medview.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
          f5= '%s/%s_mode%s_wmap.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)
          f6= '%s/%s_mode%s_cbar.png' %(outdir,astr,e+1)

        
          lh_fs = [f1,f2,f3,f4,f5,f6]
          make_surf_montage(lh_fs,lh_surfoutfile,closefig=True,include_cbar=False,crops=crops)           
        
          rh_surfoutfile = lh_surfoutfile.replace('lh', 'rh')
          rh_fs = [r.replace('lh', 'rh') for r in lh_fs] 
          make_surf_montage(rh_fs,rh_surfoutfile,closefig=True,include_cbar=False,crops=crops)
                
        
        # modes 1-4 figure
        
        eigs = [1,2,3,4]
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=len(eigs),ncols=2,figsize=(10,8))

        for e_it, e in enumerate(eigs):
    
          ax[e_it,0].imshow(plt.imread('%s/%s_mode%s_montage_nocbar.png' %(outdir,astr,e)))
          ax[e_it,0].axis('off')  
          ax[e_it,0].set_title('%s mode %s, LH' %(unibi,e), fontsize=15)
    
          ax[e_it,1].imshow(plt.imread('%s/%s_mode%s_montage_nocbar.png' %(outdir,
                                                                   astr.replace('lh', 'rh'),e)))
          ax[e_it,1].axis('off')  
          ax[e_it,1].set_title('%s mode %s, RH' %(unibi,e), fontsize=15)

        plt.tight_layout()
    
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_binarized_redblue_surf_modes1to4.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')            
        plt.close()
    
    
        # modes 5-9 figure
    
        eigs = [5,6,7,8,9]
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=len(eigs),ncols=2,figsize=(10,10))
    
        for e_it, e in enumerate(eigs):
    
          ax[e_it,0].imshow(plt.imread('%s/%s_mode%s_montage_nocbar.png' %(outdir,astr,e)))
          ax[e_it,0].axis('off')  
          ax[e_it,0].set_title('%s mode %s, LH' %(unibi,e), fontsize=15)
    
          ax[e_it,1].imshow(plt.imread('%s/%s_mode%s_montage_nocbar.png' %(outdir,
                                                                   astr.replace('lh', 'rh'),e)))
          ax[e_it,1].axis('off')  
          ax[e_it,1].set_title('%s mode %s, RH' %(unibi,e), fontsize=15)

        plt.tight_layout()
    
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_binarized_redblue_surf_modes5to9.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')            
        plt.close()

Eigenvector Histograms¶

eig_xlims = [-0.00005,0.00005]
eig_bins = np.linspace(eig_xlims[0],eig_xlims[1],500)


for k,v in res_mats.items():
    
      
    dat = v #  res_mats['nki_%s_aCM_%s' %(v,mp)] 
              
    for unibi in ['unihemi', 'bihemi']:

        
      # Unihemispheric modes
      # --------------------
        
      if unibi == 'unihemi':

        if k == 'mpt':
          lh_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.lh.V_dp)).copy()
          rh_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.rh.V_dp)).copy()
        elif k == 'nompt':
          lh_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.lh.V)).copy()
          rh_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.rh.V)).copy()

        

        # Modes 1-4
        
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_eigenvector_histograms_modes1to4.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=4,ncols=2, figsize=(10,8))
        
        for n_it,n in enumerate([0,1,2,3]):
          lh_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it,0])
          rh_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it,1])
          ax[n_it,0].set_title('LH mode %s' %(n+1))            
          ax[n_it,1].set_title('RH mode %s' %(n+1))            
            
        for a in ax.ravel(): a.set_xlim(eig_xlims); a.set_xlabel('');         

        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.savefig(f,bbox_inches='tight')
        plt.close()

            
            
        # Modes 5-9
        
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_eigenvector_histograms_modes5to9.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=5,ncols=2, figsize=(10,10))
        
        for n_it,n in enumerate([4,5,6,7,8]):
          lh_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it,0])
          rh_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it,1])
          ax[n_it,0].set_title('LH mode %s' %(n+1))            
          ax[n_it,1].set_title('RH mode %s' %(n+1))           
            
          
        for a in ax.ravel(): a.set_xlim(eig_xlims); a.set_xlabel('');         
            
        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.savefig(f,bbox_inches='tight')
        plt.close()
        
        
            
            
      # Bihemispheric modes
      # -------------------
            
            
      elif unibi == 'bihemi':
        if k == 'mpt':        
          bihemi_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.bihemi.V_dp)).copy()
        elif k == 'nompt':
          bihemi_evecs = DataFrame(np.fliplr(dat.bihemi.V)).copy()
     

        # Modes 1-4
        
        
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_eigenvector_histograms_modes1to4.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=4,ncols=1, figsize=(10,8))
        
        for n_it,n in enumerate([0,1,2,3]):
          bihemi_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it])
          ax[n_it].set_title('Bihemi mode %s' %(n+1))            

        for a in ax.ravel(): a.set_xlim(eig_xlims); a.set_xlabel('');         
            
        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.savefig(f,bbox_inches='tight')
        plt.close()

        
        # Modes 5-9
        
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_eigenvector_histograms_modes5to9.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=5,ncols=1, figsize=(10,10))
        
        for n_it,n in enumerate([4,5,6,7,8]):
          bihemi_evecs[n].plot(kind='hist',bins=eig_bins,alpha=0.6,ax=ax[n_it])
          ax[n_it].set_title('Bihemi mode %s' %(n+1))            
          
        for a in ax.ravel(): a.set_xlim(eig_xlims); a.set_xlabel('');         
            
        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.savefig(f,bbox_inches='tight')
        plt.close()

Eigenvalues¶

With multiprecision toolbox only...

data = res_mats['mpt']

Convert the eigenvalue matrices to 1-D vectors and place in pandas dataframe for easy manipulation and `visualization

lh_evals = DataFrame(flipud(diag(data.lh.D_dp)), columns=['LH']).copy()
rh_evals = DataFrame(flipud(diag(data.rh.D_dp)), columns=['RH']).copy()
bihemi_evals = DataFrame(flipud(diag(data.bihemi.D_dp)), columns=['Bihemi']).copy()

all_evals = concat([lh_evals,rh_evals,bihemi_evals], axis=1)

all_evals.index = all_evals.index+1
all_evals.index.names = ['Eig #']

List the first 9 eigenvalues from the three decompositions

d(all_evals.ix[0:9])
LH RH Bihemi
Eig #
1 9153.560219 9807.030345 12732.348770
2 4752.778243 5461.774554 8416.090011
3 4098.315714 4960.695621 7797.658986
4 3686.869711 4126.725927 6643.064724
5 3376.674382 3421.572334 6157.623647
6 2754.671823 3127.047408 5149.972539
7 2423.002160 2555.429246 4734.356370
8 2015.952165 2219.155696 4193.572468
9 1596.822935 2021.586019 4083.452866

..in visual form:

f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM_mpt_eigenvalue_spectrum_first9.png' % outdir

all_evals.ix[0:9].plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10,3), 
                         title='First 9 Left, Right, & Bihemispheric aCM Eigenvalues');
    
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

Spherical Harmonic Coefficients¶

Make spherical harmonic coefficient 'P1' figures¶

for k,v in res_mats.items():
    dat = v
    
    for unibi in ['unihemi', 'bihemi']:
        if unibi == 'unihemi':
            df_P1_lh = pd.DataFrame(dat.lh.S.P1)  
            df_P1_rh = pd.DataFrame(dat.rh.S.P1)  
        elif unibi == 'bihemi':
            df_P1_lh = pd.DataFrame(dat.bihemi.S_lh.P1)  
            df_P1_rh = pd.DataFrame(dat.bihemi.S_rh.P1)  
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_SH_coeffs_P1_LH.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        
        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=1,ncols=1,figsize=(12,4))
        
        df_P1_lh_norm = df_P1_lh/df_P1_lh.sum()
        df_P1_lh_norm.T.plot(kind='bar',ax=ax, legend=True,
                           title='nki grp aCM %s %s eigenmode SH coeffs P1 LH'%(k,unibi))
        ax.legend(['', 0,1,2,3,4],loc='upper right',title='L',fontsize=15)
        ax.set_xlabel('M', fontsize=15)
        
        plt.tight_layout()
   
        plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')
   
        plt.close()            
      

        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=1,ncols=1,figsize=(12,4))
        
        f = '%s/nki_grp_aCM__%s_%smodes_SH_coeffs_P1_RH.png' %(outdir,k,unibi)
        
        df_P1_rh_norm = df_P1_rh/df_P1_rh.sum()
        df_P1_rh_norm.T.plot(kind='bar',ax=ax, legend=True,
                           title='nki grp aCM %s %s aCM eigenmode SH coeffs P1 RH'%(k,unibi))
        ax.legend(['', 0,1,2,3,4],loc='upper right',title='L',fontsize=15)
        ax.set_xlabel('M', fontsize=15)

        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.savefig(f, bbox_inches='tight')

        plt.close()
